definition: practicing complete abstinence from alcoholic beverages, a reformer who opposes the use of intoxicating beverages, remove the moisture from and make dry
details:
adjective
- practicing complete abstinence from alcoholic beverages
= example: practicing complete abstinence from alcoholic beverages
= synonyms: teetotal
- lacking warmth or emotional involvement
= example: lacking warmth or emotional involvement
- having a large proportion of strong liquor
= example: having a large proportion of strong liquor
- without a mucous or watery discharge
= example: without a mucous or watery discharge
- humorously sarcastic or mocking
= example: humorously sarcastic or mocking
= synonyms: ironic
- (of food) eaten without a spread or sauce or other garnish
= example: (of food) eaten without a spread or sauce or other garnish
- having no adornment or coloration
= example: having no adornment or coloration
- unproductive especially of the expected results
= example: unproductive especially of the expected results
- used of solid substances in contrast with liquid ones
= example: used of solid substances in contrast with liquid ones
- lacking interest or stimulation
= synonyms: juiceless
- (of liquor) having a low residual sugar content because of decomposition of sugar during fermentation
= example: (of liquor) having a low residual sugar content because of decomposition of sugar during fermentation
- not shedding tears
= example: not shedding tears
- free from liquid or moisture
- not producing milk
= example: not producing milk
- opposed to or prohibiting the production and sale of alcoholic beverages
= example: opposed to or prohibiting the production and sale of alcoholic beverages
- lacking moisture or volatile components
= example: lacking moisture or volatile components
noun
- a reformer who opposes the use of intoxicating beverages
= synonyms: prohibitionist
verb
- remove the moisture from and make dry
= example: remove the moisture from and make dry
= synonyms: dry out
- become dry or drier
= example: become dry or drier
= synonyms: dry out
